description: Triangle T(n,k) (0<=k<=n) giving number of chains of length k in partially ordered set formed from subsets of n-set by inclusion.
comments: The relation of this triangle to A143494 given in the Formula section leads to the following combinatorial interpretation: T(n,k) counts the number of partitions of the set {1,2,...,n+2} into k + 2 blocks where 1 and 2 belong to two distinct blocks and the remaining k blocks are labeled from a fixed set of k labels. - _Peter Bala_, Jul 10 2014
